edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.backend
Class StandardQueryProcessor

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.backend.QueryProcessor
        |
        +--edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.backend.StandardQueryProcessor
Direct Known Subclasses:
LuceneQueryProcessor, WWWQueryProcessor
public abstract class StandardQueryProcessor
extends QueryProcessor

This QueryProcessor implementation, while still abstract, is still a bit more concrete and is a good one to subclass. The idea is that since an LSPMetaAttributes object should contain all the information about what is legal and possible in a query, it ought to be used as the basis for the setActualFilter(), setActualRanking(), and validateQuery() methods. The class receives the LSPMetaAttributes object through its constructor.

Once it is initialized, the class's setActualFilter() and setActualRanking() methods will eliminate all illegal field/modifier combinations from the incoming query's filter and ranking, and will make a best-effort attempt at providing as much of the filter and query as possible. The validateQuery() method will throw an exception if one of the following conditions are true:

  • The queryPartsSupported property of LSPMetaAttributes does not contain an "F", but the query contains a filter
  • The queryPartsSupported property of LSPMetaAttributes does not contain an "R", but the query contains a ranking
  • The query has neither a filter nor a ranking

The class also expands the any field to an "OR" of all legal fields.
